sourceDesc.bibl: Birth Control Leader Enroute to Japan, The San Bernardino County Sun, Oct. 12, 1952, p.1

docBody.head: Birth Control Leader Enroute to Japan

p.q: Margaret Sanger, 65-year-old grandmother and perennial advocate of birth control, is en route to Japan to tell its residents of her ideas. She left here on the Lurline.

docBody.p: "Thirty years ago when I fist tried to give my message to Japan I was allowed to land, but not to speak at public meetings," she told newsmen. "Japan's population then was 61 million; today it is 84 million and the problem is how to feed all those people."
